hypothesis_content.title: Sector-Rotation Pairs Trade on L1 vs L2 Tokens
hypothesis_content.statement: When the L1/L2 token price ratio (weighted basket) deviates more than 1.8σ from its 45-day mean during NEUTRAL regimes, and is confirmed by 3-day momentum divergence in trading volume ratios, a mean-reversion trade will be profitable within 10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: L1 and L2 tokens represent different blockchain layers but are fundamentally linked. During neutral regimes, sector rotation causes temporary imbalances. Volume confirmation helps filter false signals. The 45-day window captures medium-term equilibrium.
entry_conditions: L1 basket (BTC, ETH, SOL) vs L2 basket (ARB, OP, MATIC) price ratio
Price ratio z-score > |1.8| based on 45-day mean
Volume ratio (L1 vol/L2 vol) 3-day change opposes price ratio move
Aggregate funding rates for both sectors < |0.01|

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price ratio returns to ±0.5σ of 45-day mean
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price ratio moves to ±2.5σ from mean

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of trades are profitable, or average holding period >8 days for profitable trades.
